p.s: The blogpost on enviromentenvironment, written by Ankita Mitra and published in 2014, deals with the drastic increase of enviromentalenvironmental pollution.
The author states that if the pollution of the enviromentenvironment gets out of hand the word is going to be in big danger.
In the following I will analyze the authorsauthor's intention by focusing of she makes us of language and stylistic devices.
The author starts with a statement about enviromentalenvironmental pollution, so the readers know what the blogpost is going to be about.
The langugelanguage that is being used is formal, although the author is getting emotional at some points.

The vocabulary is filled with complex words and phrases such as biosphere (l. 6), synthetic detergents (l. 23)... She underlines the importance of her blog with strong adjectives which highlight the devastating effects of enviromentalenvironmental pollution.
In addition to that, she makes us of enumerations in line 6 no man, no animals, no plants and in line 7 oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide, argon and water vapor.
Mitra makes use of authority arguments (l. 26-27), (l. 33) in order to show the readers that not only herself is worried about the enviromentsenvironments but also experts anand scientists.
Besides that she mentions tragic events from the past to create an emotional connetionconnection to the readers.
For example the Hiroshima incident, which occured in 1945.
In line 34 she makes us of a simile to convince the readers that an accident like Hiroshima, could also happen to them at every time.
The author wants to convince the readers to act now, to prevent the earth from mass extinction and to save our planet.

Considering all these aspects, it can be said that Ankita Mitra did a great job to spread awareness about enviromentalenvironmental pollution and even if people just start thinking about what could be changed, it is the first stop for a better world and enviromentenvironment.
